forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 55. Southwest wind 8 to 14 mph.

forecast.name: Thursday
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly sunny. High near 64, with temperatures falling to around 62 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 7 to 23 mph, with gusts as high as 29 mph.

weather_report:
As the vibrant city of San Francisco awakens beneath a skyline threaded with tendrils of low-hanging clouds, the atmosphere offers a blend of mildness and mystery. The overnight hours have ushered in a gentle embrace of mostly cloudy skies, maintaining a comfortable low around 55 degrees. As morning unfolds, the remnants of night may linger in the air—a soft breeze from the southwest dances between buildings, stirring the promise of a more dynamic day ahead.

Come Thursday, the forecast reveals a transition to partly sunny conditions, though the marine layer continues to cling to the horizon, veiling the Golden Gate Bridge in a wistful haze. As daylight progresses, the temperature hovers around a modest 64 degrees before trailing off into the afternoon chill of 62, encouraging light layers for those venturing outdoors. The breeze picks up its pace, offering swift gusts that may invigorate one’s spirit—perfect for a leisurely stroll along the Embarcadero or an unobtrusive visit to one of the local cafés. Whether savoring a quiet moment with a good book in a park or watching the tide roll in, today’s ambiance invites a genuine connection with the ebb and flow of the city’s heartbeat, wrapping you in serenity against the ever-present backdrop of fog.
